summary.para: Contains classes which implement the main functionality of the WPF Accordion control. To use these classes in XAML code, add the xmlns:dxa=”“ namespace reference.
Provides access to commands.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.param: An accordion control that has raised the event.
A previously selected item.
A currently selected item.

summary.para: Gets the item that has been selected.
Gets the previously selected item.
Lists values that specify the Accordion’s view mode.
All root and children items are displayed.
Only child items of a single root item specified by the AccordionControl.SelectedRootItem property are displayed.
Provides data for the event.

member.name: P:DevExpress.Xpf.Accordion.CanSelectItemEventArgs.CanSelect

summary.para: Gets or sets whether the processed accordion item can be selected.

member.value: true, if the processed accordion item can be selected; otherwise, false.

summary.para: Gets the processed item.
Lists values that specify whether clicking a collapsed item selects it or invokes a popup with the child items.
Clicking a collapsed item selects it.
Clicking a collapsed item invokes a popup with the child items.
Lists values that specify the display mode for accordion items in the collapsed AccordionControl.
Only the item’s header is shown.
Both the item’s header and glyph are shown.
Only the item’s glyph is shown.
Lists values that specify the position of the popup with Accordion items when the Accordion is in the Collapse Mode.
The popup is placed to the left of the collapsed Accordion.
The popup is placed to the right of the collapsed Accordion.
Lists values that specify the position of the expand button within the accordion item’s header.
The expand button is displayed at the left side of the accordion item.
The expand button is not displayed.
The expand button is displayed at the right side of the accordion item.
Lists values that specify the number of accordion items that can be expanded simultaneously.
At least one accordion item is always expanded.
Any number of accordion items can be expanded.
A single accordion item is always expanded.
A single accordion item can be expanded.
Lists values that specify the position and visibility of the glyph within the accordion item.
The glyph is displayed at the left side of the accordion item.
The glyph is hidden.
The glyph is displayed at the right side of the accordion item.
The glyph is displayed above the accordion item.
Interface that should be implemented by a class that retrieves the ‘s children from the data source.

member.name: M:DevExpress.Xpf.Accordion.IChildrenSelector.SelectChildren(System.Object)

summary.para: Retrieves the ‘s children from the data source.

member.param: The accordion item whose children are retrieved from the data source.
member.returns: A collection of objects that are the children of an accordion item.

summary.para: Lists values that specify the display mode of the accordion item.
The accordion item‘s margins are calculated based on the hierarchy level. The item processes mouse input and keyboard navigation.
The accordion item directly renders the content of the header. Margin calculation and mouse processing are bypassed. The glyph and expand button are disabled.
Lists values that indicate the item’s visibility mode.
The item is collapsed, the popup with the child items is hidden.
The item is collapsed, the popup with the child items is visible.
The item is visible.
Lists values that specify whether to enable a uniform style for root and subordinate items.
A special style is used for root items.
A uniform style is used for both root and subordinate items.
Lists values that specify whether s can be selected.
accordion items cannot be selected.
A single accordion item can be selected.
Lists values that specify whether an end-user can select items or both items and groups.
Only subitems can be selected.
Both the root items and subitems can be selected.
Lists values that specify the position of the Summary Item relative to regular items.
The Summary Item is shown under the regular items.
The Summary Item is hidden.
The Summary Item is shown above the regular items.
